questions.question: What business rules apply to the input parameter, such as range limits for wait time or validation requirements before the MOVE at line 37?
Line 34 starts PROCEDURE DIVISION with no named paragraphs, but paragraphs section documents '0000-MAIN'. Is this name accurate or inferred?
What about error handling for non-numeric input in PARM-VALUE? The MOVE at line 37 from PIC X(8) to PIC 9(8) COMP could cause a runtime abend if invalid.
Inputs describe PARM-VALUE as 'PARAMETER' from SYSIN, but it's defined in WORKING-STORAGE at line 31 and ACCEPTed at 36. Should this be classified as file input (SYSIN) rather than PARAMETER?
The paragraphs section documents '0000-MAIN' citing lines 34 and 40, but line 34 is PROCEDURE DIVISION. with no paragraph name defined. Is '0000-MAIN' accurate or inferred? (Previous: Q-82E166EB)
What about business rules for the range limits of the wait time in MVSWAIT-TIME (PIC 9(8) COMP)? No checks or limits are present in the code.

Business rules BR001 imply validation on numeric conversion (conditions: exactly 8 chars, numeric), but no explicit checks exist; MOVE at line 37 abends on invalid data. Does this accurately reflect enforced rules? (Previous: Q-E2AC5B48)
Inputs list PARM-VALUE as io_type 'PARAMETER', but it is ACCEPTed from SYSIN at line 36 (file-like input). Should this be reclassified as 'FILE' or 'SYSIN'? (Previous: Q-0C2DCEAF)
